author: A D Balasubramaniyan
text:
Collector insists on adhering to code of conduct

R. Nanthagopal, Collector of Vellore and Superintendent of Police P. Pakalavan, at the all-party meeting with election officials in the Collectorate on Saturday. -Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

Following the announcement of election schedule and in view of election code of conduct coming into force, District Collectors of Tiruvannamalai and Vellore conducted a meeting of representatives of various political parties.

In Tiruvannamalai District, Collector A. Gnanasekaran presided over the meeting.

Palani of DMK, Kumarasamy of AIADMK, Kalingan of DMDK, M.Veerabadhran, state committee member of CPI(M), Newton of VCK were among those who participated. The Collector insisted that political parties should adhere to the code of conduct and refrain from distributing money and inciting religious sentiments.

District Revenue Officer S.P alani also took part in the meet.

In Vellore, District Collector R.Nanthagopal presided over the meeting. SP P. Pakalavan was among those present.

Returning officers of 13 constituencies in the district participated. CPI(M) District Secretary Narayanan demanded a centralized toll free number and a WhatsApp number to register complaints in Vellore district.
title: All-party meet held in Vellore, Tiruvannamalai
